question.text: Which of the following is a 4-carbon compound?

solution.text: Chemical substances containing carbon atoms are known as carbon compounds. The compound having 4 carbon atoms like oxaloacetic acid which has the chemical formula <math><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>₂</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi><mo>₂</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">C</mi><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mo>₂</mo><mi mathvariant="normal">H</mi></math>. It is a 4 carbon compound that acts as an intermediate of the citric acid cycle by combining with acetyl-CoA and producing citric acid having six carbon atoms. This compound is then reduced to malate using NADH.
